65414.name: Children age 8 who report physical punishment by teachers
65414.description: Children’s self-reports of teacher’s use of physical punishment in the past week, at age 8. Reports combine the response categories ‘once or twice’ and ‘most/all of the time’.
65414.datasetName: Corporal Punishment in Schools - Longitudinal Evidence from Ethiopia, India, Peru and Vietnam (UNICEF 2015)

source.name: Ogando Portela and Pells (2015)
source.dataPublishedBy: Ogando Portela, María José, and Kirrily Pells. "Corporal punishment in schools: longitudinal evidence from Ethiopia, India Peru and Viet Nam." (2015).
source.dataPublisherSource: Young Lives longitudinal study of children in four countries over 15 years.
source.additionalInfo: The data in this chart comes from Figure 2 in the source paper, where there are also estimates of children's self-reports of teacher’s use of physical punishment on other children: https://ourworldindata.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Teacher-violence-UNICEF-2015.png
